programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: This biographical drama explores the genius and shortcomings of computing guru Steve Jobs in backstage vignettes spanning 14 years, as he and his closest advisers prepare for three different public presentations of era-defining technologies. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Cloud Atlas
programme.desc: This epic comprises six tales from various historical eras. An 18th-century notary goes on a sea voyage; a musician becomes an apprentice to a famous composer in 1930s Belgium; a journalist uncovers corruption at a nuclear power plant in '70s California; a contemporary publisher seeks refuge from gangsters at a nursing home; a clone escapes her job at a fast-food establishment in futuristic Korea; a tribesman struggles to survive in a postapocalyptic wasteland. (cc)(n)

programme.title: The Glass House
programme.desc: After their parents are killed in a car crash, two orphaned children inherit $4 million and move in with the Glasses, a seemingly kind couple who were friends of their parents, but the wealthy couple are not as benevolent as they seem. After one of the kids discovers that the Glasses have a drug problem and owe money to a loan shark, she confides in the family attorney. When he is found dead, she begins to understand just how dangerous her new parents are. (cc)(n)

programme.title: High Crimes
programme.desc: When her ex-Marine husband is accused of past war crimes, a lawyer enlists the help of a fellow attorney who's wrestling with his own demons. (cc)(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: As his family travel from Egypt to Nazareth, a 7-year-old Jesus wishes to learn more about his identity and place in the world. Meanwhile, Herod Antipas dispatches a Roman centurion to kill the boy, whose miraculous powers might be a threat to his reign. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Blackhat
programme.desc: A furloughed convict teams with a joint American-Chinese anticyber-theft task force to root out a hacker based in Southeast Asia. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Child 44

programme.desc: In the Season 1 finale, Lizzie contemplates getting back with her ex while Sam wrestles with choosing between two guys. (cc)

programme.title: Goodfellas
programme.desc: Gangster saga explores the life of organized crime as it chronicles the true-life rise and fall of New York mobster and FBI informant Henry Hill and the more prominent "goodfellas" in his world. Soon he finds himself the target of both the feds and his Mafia family, who feel that he has become a threat to their security with his reckless dealings

But Franklin (Noah Gray-Cabey) smells a rat. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire has been asked to the senior prom, but Michael won't let her go. Their compromise: Michael and Jay will chaperone. Suffice it to say that Jay thinks more of the plan than Claire does (or than Michael does, at first). Meanwhile, Jr's rehabbing an old car and he wants Michael to pay for it. Michael agrees, but that isn't necessarily good news for Jr. Donovan: Roshawn Franklin. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Jamie Foxx Show
programme.desc: Jamie writes a jingle for a commercial promoting the King's Tower and he charges his aunt and uncle for his services, which jeopardizes his free lodging at the hotel. Tash: Shelley Malil. Junior: Garrett Morris. Helen: Ellia English. Braxton: Christopher B. Duncan. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Jamie Foxx Show
programme.desc: Jamie is promoted to supervisor at Jingles 2000. His first task: fire an incompetent writer who is also one of his friends. Meanwhile, a flu epidemic hits the hotel staff. Curtis: Chris Spencer. Braxton: Christopher B. Duncan. Nicole: Rhona L. Bennett. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Jamie Foxx Show
programme.desc: Jamie joyfully moves into his own bachelor pad, but when Fancy starts decorating it for him, he begins to feel a little crowded by her constant presence. Fancy: Garcelle Beauvais. Jamie: Jamie Foxx. Junior: Garrett Morris. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Jamie Foxx Show
programme.desc: The pressures of being a supervisor affect the quality of Jamie's jingles, so he passes off one of Mouse's ideas as his own, which leads to a guilt-filled dream about his future. Mouse: Suli McCullough. Bob: Blake Clark. Fancy: Garcelle Beauvais. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.sub-title: Papa's Got a Brand New Excuse
programme.desc: Ben Vereen plays Will's long-lost father, who breezes into town and promises Will the moon, which angers an unforgiving Philip (James Avery). Vivian: Daphne Maxwell Reid. Hilary: Karyn Parsons. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: A stranger makes a generous offer for the Banks estate, which prompts the family to reminisce about their good times there. Donald Trump and Marla Maples have cameos. Ron: Tom Henschel. Philip: James Avery. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Will returns to Philly and finds he's the butt of friends' jokes and has a reputation as a chicken. Omar: Jacques Apollo Bolton. Dick Clark: Himself. Chill: Daryl "Chill" Mitchell. Duke: Robert Costanzo. Will: Will Smith. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Conclusion. Ashley lets stardom go to her head, while Will is cut down to size by a record producer. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.sub-title: What's Will Got to Do with It?
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. Philip and Will don't see eye to eye on Ashley's singing career, but record producer Gordy Berry is all ears. Quincy Jones and Little Richard make cameo appearances. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Will loses points as a role model for Nicky (Ross Bagley) while visiting an ever-positive kiddie hero who brings joy to youngsters---but not to Will. Dougie: Monty Hoffman. Santa: Dick O'Neill. Leeza Gibbons: Herself. Will: Will Smith. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: K. Michelle: My Life
programme.sub-title: Between a Tour and a Hard Place
programme.desc: In the third-season premiere, K. Michelle attends the grand opening of her new restaurant while taking a break from her tour. Later, Jonathan and P. London get in an argument when the event doesn't go as planned. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: K. Michelle: My Life
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. K. Michelle heads home to Memphis to spend time with her loved ones. Later, K. is shocked to learn that her sister is giving up her career and moving to Atlanta. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: Leave It to Stevie
programme.desc: In the series premiere, Stevie readjusts to the single life following his public breakup with Joseline. Later, Joc and Scrappy plan a guys' night out; and Stevie's daughters organize a yard sale to help their dad start anew. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: Leave It to Stevie
programme.desc: Stevie's excited to spend time with Ray J while he's in town. Later, Stevie unexpectedly falls for an old friend, but his romantic feelings may not be mutual. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop
programme.desc: Drewski wants to put Bianca on a track, but his girlfriend disapproves of his plan. Later, Snoop and J question their future together; and Yandy tries to keep the peace within her family, but rumors about Samantha lead to trouble. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop
programme.desc: Yandy encounters Erika and Samantha; J gets angry with Sofi Green; and Rich's daughter travels to NYC to check on his new girlfriend. Later, Cardi's furious after discovering that Swift is in a relationship. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop
programme.desc: Cardi faces the consequences of her actions; Drewski's torn between business and pleasure; and Kimbella makes a discovery about Juelz. Later, Rich's girlfriend encounters someone from his past. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop
programme.desc: Bianca opens up about her feelings for Drewski, leading Sky to intervene. Later, Snoop confronts her past and makes a decision about her future with J; and tensions between Yandy and Erika escalate. (repeat)(n)

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Modelka Deb Dobson ginie w wypadku samochodowym. Powraca na ziemię w asyście niebiańskiego przewodnika Freda. Za jego sprawą otrzymuje nową ziemską powłokę ambitnej prawniczki Jane Bingum

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Jane dostaje sprawę Lucy Tyner, kelnerki, która straciła pracę w barze z powodu nadwagi. W tym samym czasie kancelaria prowadzi sprawę pewnego zdradzonego męża, który nie zgadza się na rozwód

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Ma zostać wznowiony proces, który już kiedyś wygrała Jane ratując przed eksmisją rodzinę kierowcy, który zginął w wypadku samochodowym. Deb musi jeszcze raz podjąć walkę(r)

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Kim zajmuje się sprawą psa, zwanego David Beckham. Pies zdechł. Jego właściciel polecił go sklonować. Choć kopia jest łudząco podobna do oryginału, pies nie potrafi się właściwie zachowywać(r)

programme.title: Z pamiętnika lekarki
programme.desc: Doktor Haase ma złamane serce, kilka kilogramów nadwagi i nadzieję na odnalezienie prawdziwej miłości. Na razie porzucona przez niewiernego narzeczonego wraca do rodzinnego domu

programme.title: Sala operacyjna: waga ciężka
programme.desc: Trwają przygotowania do operacji Emila i jego mamy. Waldkowi, mężowi Elżbiety, ciężko opanować emocje. Z kolei Bożena i Olga idą na siłownię, by zgubić kilka kilogramów przed zabiegiem. Na miejscu spotykają Karolinę, która również musi schudnąć. Emil i Ela po operacji jedzą swój pierwszy posiłek - kleik. Tymczasem na siłowni Karolina zaczyna mieć problem z kręgosłupem i musi opuścić salę treningową. Bożena i Olga wyciskają siódme poty. Emil po powrocie ze szpitala postanawia nauczyć swojego pupila Dolara posłuszeństwa i zapisuje go na tresurę, co też zwiększa aktywność chłopaka. Ela po incydentach z ciśnieniem zaczyna regularnie je kontrolować. Bożena i Olga przechodzą próbę wagi

programme.title: Sala operacyjna
programme.desc: Gdy Joanna miała 26 lat, zdiagnozowano u niej astmę. Przez następnych 15 lat kobieta była poddawana leczeniu sterydami, co spowodowało u niej przyrost wagi do 145 kg. Oprócz tego chora przeszła liczne zabiegi: operację pękniętego płuca oraz wszczepienie i usunięcie rozrusznika serca. Po ostatniej interwencji chirurgicznej lekarze nie dawali Joannie większych szans na przeżycie. Rok po zabiegu pacjentka schudła 40 kg, jednak na jej ciele pozostały fałdy skóry; nadmiar ciała uciska przeponę i utrudnia oddychanie. W dodatku skóra jest niezwykle wrażliwa, pęka przy nawet delikatnym pociągnięciu. Ze względu na duże ryzyko lekarze odmawiali Joannie przeprowadzenia kolejnej operacji. W końcu kobiecie udało się znaleźć specjalistę, który może pomóc jej wrócić do normalnego życia. W przygotowaniach do zabiegu wspierają ją ukochany mąż i dzieci(n)

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Modelka Deb Dobson ginie w wypadku samochodowym. Powraca na ziemię w asyście niebiańskiego przewodnika Freda. Za jego sprawą otrzymuje nową ziemską powłokę ambitnej prawniczki Jane Bingum

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Jane dostaje sprawę Lucy Tyner, kelnerki, która straciła pracę w barze z powodu nadwagi. W tym samym czasie kancelaria prowadzi sprawę pewnego zdradzonego męża, który nie zgadza się na rozwód

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Ma zostać wznowiony proces, który już kiedyś wygrała Jane ratując przed eksmisją rodzinę kierowcy, który zginął w wypadku samochodowym. Deb musi jeszcze raz podjąć walkę(r)

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Ma zostać wznowiony proces, który już kiedyś wygrała Jane ratując przed eksmisją rodzinę kierowcy, który zginął w wypadku samochodowym. Deb musi jeszcze raz podjąć walkę(r)

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Kim zajmuje się sprawą psa, zwanego David Beckham. Pies zdechł. Jego właściciel polecił go sklonować. Choć kopia jest łudząco podobna do oryginału, pies nie potrafi się właściwie zachowywać(r)

programme.title: Jej Szerokość Afrodyta
programme.desc: Kim zajmuje się sprawą psa, zwanego David Beckham. Pies zdechł. Jego właściciel polecił go sklonować. Choć kopia jest łudząco podobna do oryginału, pies nie potrafi się właściwie zachowywać(r)

programme.title: Program muzyczny
programme.desc: Zestawienie największych przebojów z Polski i zagranicy

programme.title: Z pamiętnika lekarki
programme.desc: Doktor Haase ma złamane serce, kilka kilogramów nadwagi i nadzieję na odnalezienie prawdziwej miłości. Na razie porzucona przez niewiernego narzeczonego wraca do rodzinnego domu

programme.title: Sala operacyjna: waga ciężka
programme.desc: Trwają przygotowania do operacji Emila i jego mamy. Waldkowi, mężowi Elżbiety, ciężko opanować emocje. Z kolei Bożena i Olga idą na siłownię, by zgubić kilka kilogramów przed zabiegiem. Na miejscu spotykają Karolinę, która również musi schudnąć. Emil i Ela po operacji jedzą swój pierwszy posiłek - kleik. Tymczasem na siłowni Karolina zaczyna mieć problem z kręgosłupem i musi opuścić salę treningową. Bożena i Olga wyciskają siódme poty. Emil po powrocie ze szpitala postanawia nauczyć swojego pupila Dolara posłuszeństwa i zapisuje go na tresurę, co też zwiększa aktywność chłopaka. Ela po incydentach z ciśnieniem zaczyna regularnie je kontrolować. Bożena i Olga przechodzą próbę wagi

programme.title: Taka sytuacja
programme.desc: Aktorzy i prezenterzy telewizyjni opowiadają o swoich perypetiach związanych z remontem mieszkania lub domu oraz udzielają rad. Wystąpią m.in. Grażyna Wolszczak i Katarzyna Kwiatkowska(r)

programme.title: Show Me What You're Made Of
programme.desc: In episode four of Show Me What You're Made Of our teens they leave Cambodia to fly further east to the island of Taiwan. Here they head straight to an enormous tea plantation where they grow the tea for the British export market. It's been a tough trip for our five teens and within minutes of arriving at the tea factory one of them feels unwell. With a man down how will the other four cope with the very physical work involved? Their boss is the strictest one yet and he is not a man to be messed with. At the end of their first shift the boss proves that he is very serious about tea when he sacks one of the team. They may be shocked but can they pull together as a team to turn this situation around? Show Me What You're Made Of is presented by Stacey Dooley.

programme.title: Eve
programme.desc: Eve's attempts to help her sister KT pass for human are derailed when a miraculously recovered Katherine returns to Calimov. To Nick and Eve's horror, Katherine reveals her new range of childbots, which have been placed with local families. To prevent Katherine restoring KT to factory settings, Eve smuggles her out of Calimov and back to the Clarke house. But with Will and Lily insisting KT is returned to Calimov, Eve and her sister are forced to take matters into their own hands. The situation escalates when Katherine's childbots start to malfunction and it is KT who comes under suspicion, admitting she has no wish to pass as human. In order to make Eve prove she loves her sister as she is, KT wants Eve to reveal her own robot identity to the world. Trapped inside the house by the childbots, and with police and reporters gathering outside, the gang's worst fears have been realised. With Eve about to admit her secret to the world on live TV, can Will's nanobots save the day?.

programme.title: Eve
programme.desc: Rebecca and Nick are desperate to get to the bottom of Will's nanobot problem, so they take him into Calimov to run some tests. Whilst there, Nick insists that Katherine deactivate KT after the trouble she has caused, but Katherine has other ideas. Meanwhile Abe is disgruntled after Lily refuses to help him with his homework - she's more interested in her date with Cain. Maddy has her hands full preparing for the arrival of the new baby and tells Abe that it's time he grew up and took some responsibility for himself. A dejected Abe goes to Eve for help. As Eve completes his homework, Abe wonders aloud what's so special about babies - why do they get everyone's attention? After researching human child-rearing, Eve cites 'helplessness' as the main reason. Inspired, a scheming Abe fakes being ill to regain Maddy's attention, but his plan backfires. Suspecting Abe has appendicitis a concerned Maddy calls an ambulance! Once again Abe begs Eve for help and so Eve hacks the local traffic control system, gridlocking the roads and preventing the emergency services from getting through. The situation escalates when Maddy unexpectedly goes into labour. With the roads blocked, Abe must man-up and help his mum - while Eve goes for help. Across town Will crashes Lily's date revealing that Cain is a fully paid up member of anti-tech group PRICE. At Calimov, under Katherine's interrogation, KT reveals how Will ended the childbot siege using his nanobots. Katherine now has the leverage she needs to persuade Nick to keep KT online. At the Watsons', Eve and the gang return with help - to find Abe has successfully delivered his baby brother!.

programme.title: Eve
programme.desc: For the umpteenth time Eve defeats her friends at gaming, singing a football chant in triumph. Eve explains how, in a matter of nanoseconds, her predictive software allows her to always choose the best possible course of action - hence the winning streak. But it cannot predict random events like lottery numbers, much to Abe's disappointment. Unknown to the gang, Cain waits outside with Michael Hoffman, the son of the late Lord Hoffman. In their attempts to find rogue robots, Cain pitches his theory that - given the multiple incidents involving robot activity at the Clarke house, plus Nick's prior history with Mary Douglas - this is a good place to start. When the doorbell rings, Eve answers to find Cain and Michael. Detecting their concealed EMPs, she slams the door on them. Spooked by this odd behaviour they break in, fearful that there may be another robot siege in progress. Once inside they learn that Eve is the robot and blast her with their EMPs - only for time to rewind. This has simply been a simulation in Eve's predictive software! Eve runs multiple simulations trying to find a way to stop Cain and Michael discovering her robot nature, but in each one her identity is exposed and Cain and Michael destroy her. With time running out, Eve recruits the Will and Lily simulations. Lily speculates that Eve is experiencing anxiety. She has become so human, that it has caused her predictive software to malfunction. Eve must disable the software and go it alone. Although Eve manages to evade discovery, neither she nor the gang realise that, while inside, Cain has bugged Nick's computer and is one step closer to the truth.

programme.title: Eve
programme.desc: Mary resorts to extreme measures to head off the threat of Cain and PRICE, enlisting KT to help her temporarily transfer her consciousness to Eve. With KT AWOL from Calimov, a distracted Nick and Katherine welcome back Zac, who is helping them answer questions about how Mary was able to duplicate his personality. Excited about Zac's return, Eve suggests he join the gang's picnic that afternoon. To everyone's surprise Zac brings his new girlfriend, and for the first time Eve experiences jealousy. Spotting KT hovering nearby puts Eve on high alert. Operating under Protocol Zero, KT is Mary's automaton, and is primed to execute her mother's plan. Meanwhile, on Abe's misguided advice, Eve kisses Will in an attempt to make Zac jealous. For a moment, in robot communion, Will sees inside Eve's mind and then passes out. In the ensuing chaos, KT places a magnetic patch containing Mary's consciousness onto Eve. Inhabiting Eve's robot body, Mary begins to question Cain about PRICE. Separately, a revived Will tells Lily that when he kissed Eve he could see inside her systems. They theorise that this made her malfunction and fixate on the idea of jealousy - perhaps she is attempting to make Zac jealous by paying Cain so much attention? Little do they realise the truth. Later, Eve - still possessed by Mary - meets Cain in the park, where she interrogates him about PRICE's super-EMP. Mary decides that Cain must be terminated. Will intervenes in the nick of time, kissing Eve again. The disruption to her circuits forces Mary to relinquish control, but Will hears Mary's voice in Eve's mind. The gang are left with a burning question - could Mary be alive?.

programme.title: Eve
programme.desc: Eve tries to prevent a war between humans and robots, and Will struggles to control his nanobots and his feelings for Lily.

programme.title: Eve
programme.desc: Will struggles to control his nanobots, and Mary plots revenge from beyond the grave.

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old pianist Shane has three weeks to compose a piece of music inspired by CBBC before performing it at the Royal Northern College of Music in Manchester.

programme.title: Lost & Found Music Studios

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Visitors gather to watch videos made by Ashdene Lodge residents about their lives there, with the focus turning on Tyler's classic moments. Drama based on books by Jacqueline Wilson, starring Miles Butler-Hughton.

programme.title: Show Me What You're Made Of
programme.desc: In episode five of Show Me What You're Made Of it's their last factory in Asia and our teens make their way to a fish canning plant on the Taiwanese coast. If they thought factory work would get any easier they were sadly wrong! Some of them find the fish smell overwhelming and are horrified to discover that one job is boxing up fish heads and guts after the choice meat has been canned. Can they face their worst nightmare? Will they be able to finally show their last factory boss that they can manage a day's work even they might not want to? As they finish up in Taiwan and fly home to the UK, will they be able to show their families that their incredible trip has really changed them? Show Me What You're Made Of is presented by Stacey Dooley.

programme.title: Top Class
programme.desc: Bowes Primary School from London take on St Pius X Preparatory School from Lancashire in the second semi-final. Presented by Susan Calman.

programme.title: The Dog Ate My Homework
programme.desc: Team captains Tiah and Noah compete in the children's comedy panel show hosted by Iain Stirling, featuring studio-based frolics and slapstick challenges. Featuring special guests Matthew Crosby, Lauren Layfield, Dominique Moore and Saima Chowdhury.

programme.title: Rank the Prank
programme.desc: RANK THE PRANK - pranking Hollywood style! Today our pesky pranksters are Dukafundis (Markus and Ellysa) and 'Very Intelligent Pranksters' (Evan and Ashazia) who team up with digital effects wizard Hassan Aziz and SFX specialists Marc Reichel and Andy Antoine to stage the biggest and best PUBLIC PRANKS on an unsuspecting public. The teams take over a bowling alley and it's all hands on deck to rig the hidden cameras and special effects required to bring our Pranksters' ideas to life. But which team will impress our prank-loving panel of 'Ranksters' to win the chance to stage a mind blowing MEGA PRANK on a 'target' of their choice? It's strike three for the targets when Markus and Ellysa's 'Haunted Alley' dukes it out with Evan and Ashazia's 'Hotdog Bowler'. Ranksters ... the choice is yours. For the winning team, the effectors have planned the ultimate MEGA PRANK at a car wash featuring a dirty car, a nervous driver and a meteor shower! Our 'target' may be able to avoid the meteor but will mom's car be able to do the same? One thing's for sure, this explosively entertaining mega prank strikes comedy gold!.
